image.altText: A composite image of the candidates from the two major parties in the Fadden by-election in front of the Fadden electorate map

items.synopsis: Thousands of voters on the Gold Coast will elect a new federal MP today. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Here's why experts are confident about who will win the Fadden by-election today

image.altText: Cars wait in bumper to bumper morning traffic on a busy road

items.synopsis: Australians love big cars, and it's undoing the good work of the shift to more electric and hybrid vehicles.

title.children: Australia is obsessed with big cars, and it’s a problem

image.altText: L-R: Matt Corby, Meg Mac, Flume

items.synopsis: Join us as we count down the 100 most popular triple j Like A Version's of all time!

title.children: Matt Corby, Meg Mac and Flume have placed on triple j's Hottest 100 Like A Version — but who will be #1?

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: We're really getting to the pointy end now! Here's what you heard from #50 to #41:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Here comes the top 30!

children.content: We're really getting to the pointy end now!
Here's what you heard from #50 to #41:

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: 50 songs down, 50 to go! Has your favourite made it in yet? Are you sweating??? Here's what we heard from #60 to #51
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: We're officially halfway!

children.content: Has your favourite made it in yet? Are you sweating???
Here's what we heard from #60 to #51

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Closing in on the halfway mark, 35 songs by Aussies have made it to the countdown. We know from the teaser stats released this week that there’s a massive 81 in total, so there will be plenty in the top end. I swear, it's not rigged!
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: It’s a big countdown for Aussie artists!

children.content: Closing in on the halfway mark, 35 songs by Aussies have made it to the countdown.
We know from the teaser stats released this week that there’s a massive 81 in total, so there will be plenty in the top end.

image.altText: A damaged boat at port.

items.synopsis: Xavier Doerr says he set out on Wednesday night with the crew of Port Lincoln prawn vessel FV Challenge to locate and retrieve the yacht, and arrived back in Port Lincoln this morning.

title.children: Rescued sailor retrieves damaged yacht from the ocean with help from SA fishermen

image.altText: An stlised illustration showing hands around a crystal ball with the words "p/doom" inside it.

items.synopsis: Why some AI experts are beginning to worry about the apocalypse.

title.children: It started as a dark in-joke. It could also be one of the most important questions facing humanity

image.altText: A woman with short red hair and black glasses stands in front of a woman with blonde hair and a pink blazer

items.synopsis: The novel synthetic opioid protonitazine has been detected in Victoria, Queensland, and most recently in South Australia, where health authorities have linked it to an Adelaide man's death and multiple overdoses.

title.children: A 'lethal' new drug is alarming health officials in Australia. Here's what we know about protonitazene

image.altText: A woman in white gloves adjusts a Birkin bag on a shelf

items.synopsis: From the Hermès Birkin to the Chanel classic flap, some are seeking out breathtakingly expensive handbags. But the bags aren't just status symbols — they can also be a savvy investment.

title.children: This bag costs $15,000. To buy it, you have to play an expensive, years-long game of cat and mouse

image.altText: A young woman is on the shoulders of a man in a march. She's holding an Aboriginal flag

items.synopsis: If there is a similarity between the politics of Robodebt and the sorts of things now being said under the No banner of the Voice, there is an even more significant similarity in the mechanics of what lies beneath both, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: A mysterious leaflet pushing a No vote for the Voice has jumped the shark to the issue of money

image.altText: Actress Susan Sarandon smiles as she wears red sunglasses and a blue shirt

items.synopsis: Academy-Award winner Susan Sarandon joins the chorus of striking Hollywood actors warning about the growing threat of artificial intelligence, saying that AI could use "my face, my body and my voice" without permission.

title.children: 'We need to deal with AI now': Susan Sarandon says striking actors deserve new contract for new business

image.altText: Two men collide near the tryline in a rugby league match

items.synopsis: The Cowboys are in Manly to take on the Sea Eagles after the Broncos without a few Origin stars run over the top of Canterbury. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: Manly host Cowboys after Broncos go top with thumping win over Bulldogs

image.altText: Bright, colourful flowers bloom under a dome net in a row, a small child is bent over looking in a bucket next to the row

items.synopsis: Twenty years after cheap flower imports flooded the Australian market, the focus is back on locally grown blooms as shoppers "push towards sustainability".

title.children: Cheap imports 'decimated' Australia's flower industry. Could micro farms save it?

image.altText: A coal-fired power plant

items.synopsis: Coal plants have long provided intrinsic strength to Australia's grid. How to replace those properties is one of the big challenges in the energy transition.

title.children: The physics of coal power made Australia's grid strong. What happens when it's gone?

image.altText: A woman wearing a black dress and smiling.

items.synopsis: The collapse of registered training organisation Inspire Education left many students — including some close to completing qualifications in industries with labour shortages — having to start over.

title.children: 'I took the screenshots': After months of study, records of Lorena's training in childcare disappeared

image.altText: a man standing outdoors with his arms folded looking a the camera

items.synopsis: As the NSW government pushes for more housing density in Sydney, questions about the quality of new apartment buildings have re-emerged after major developer Toplace went into administration.

title.children: The game of 'Russian roulette' facing Sydney apartment buyers

image.altText: A picture of a woman in a yellow and green image.

items.synopsis: Alkina Edwards knew she was watching something special when Indigenous player Donnell Wallam made her debut with the Australian Diamonds last year. What she didn't know was the game would change her life too.

title.children: First Nations artist designs Diamonds' World Cup uniform after powerful artwork goes viral

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: Ross and Marianne Allan together sitting on a grey couch behind a bookshelf and palnts

items.synopsis: Scans revealed a tumour and Marianne Allan was diagnosed with stage 4 pancreatic cancer. Now she and her husband Ross have pledged to donate $1 million to fast-track research projects aimed at detecting the cancer in early stages.

title.children: Marianne was heading to the movies when her doctor called her with urgent news

image.altText: A man with grey hair and glasses next to a separate photo of a young Chinese-Australian woman smiling.

items.synopsis: For years, hostage diplomacy has been Beijing's coercive tactic in dealing with the West. However, it could also cost Beijing dearly, Bang Xiao writes.

title.children: China's tactic of hostage diplomacy could backfire as Beijing awaits PM's RSVP

image.altText: A man, a teenage boy and a middle-aged woman smile on the porch of a brick home.

items.synopsis: Seventeen-year-old Hemi Edwards and his family have copped three rent increases since 2020 and he can't afford to move out. But he and group of other young change makers are determined to have their voices heard.

title.children: Hemi's rent went up by $160 — so he took his concerns straight to parliament

image.altText: A woman stands on a beach wearing a black suit and black shirt.

items.synopsis: Marta Dusseldorp, who starred in Janet King and A Place to Call Home, has become a producer and is focused on creating female-led stories, like the new TV show Bay of Fires.

title.children: Confronted by a lack of interesting female stories, Marta Dusseldorp is making her own

items.synopsis: A Swiss-French artist has used biodegradable paint to create two giant frescoes of children sketching how they see the world around them in the Swiss village of Villars-sur-Ollon.

title.children: Artist uses Swiss mountain slopes as his canvas for massive frescoes

image.altText: A photo of Lisa Marie Presley at an award ceremony. She's got long brown hair, blue eyes, and she's wearing a glittery dress.

items.synopsis: Lisa Marie Presley died after developing a small bowel obstruction — a severe complication of bariatric surgery years ago — according to the autopsy report. Experts say these types of complications are a known but rare risk.

title.children: How Lisa Marie Presley's weight loss surgery contributed to her death

image.altText: People smoke conventional cigarettes in an outdoor area in Hong Kong.

items.synopsis: Hong Kong's health secretary says the territory could build a non-smoking culture if "everyone stares in disapproval" at people who light up where they shouldn't.

title.children: Hong Kong urges public to dissuade smokers with disapproving stares

image.altText: A graphic featuring the Twitter and Threads logos.

items.synopsis: Early-adopters of Meta's new text-based platform are showing they want something more than an endless stream of "stuff".

title.children: What Threads tell us about the social media 'death spiral' and a possible 'new era'

image.altText: RBA governor Philip Lowe speaks at the Morgan Stanley Australia summit in Sydney

items.synopsis: Philip Lowe saw the unemployment rate fall to its lowest level in 50 years without a wages explosion. But he'll also be remembered for saying interest rates wouldn't rise from 0.1 per cent "until 2024 at the earliest".

title.children: Philip Lowe's term as RBA governor was split in two, and he divided opinions towards the end

image.altText: A composite image of Philip Lowe and Michele Bullock

items.synopsis: Will  RBA veteran Michele Bullock be able to deliver for a generation of home-buyers now facing possible oblivion as their monthly repayments double? She'll need a miracle, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: The 'narrow path' is locked in, and the new RBA chief can't perform miracles for home owners

image.altText: A Carlton AFL player holds the ball while being tackled by a Port Adelaide opponent.

items.synopsis: Carlton is on top of second-placed Port Adelaide, while Gold Coast defeats top-eight side St Kilda only days after sacking coach Stuart Dew. Earlier, Collingwood claimed a comfortable win over Fremantle. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre.

title.children: AFL live: Blues lead red-hot Power as Suns celebrate upset win over Saints

image.altText: army personel carrying sand bangs to make an embankment agaisnt flood waters

items.synopsis: A defence review has recommended army personnel be brought in to help in natural disasters only in "extreme circumstances".

title.children: Soldiers were a 'godsend' in the Queensland floods but now they may only be sent in as a 'last resort'

image.altText: A man in a fleuro hat bends over and reaches his hand down into layers of excavated soil.

items.synopsis: A search for the remains of Native American children buried at the site of a former boarding school in Nebraska will continue next week after four days of searching fail to uncover bones.

title.children: Archaeologists search US boarding school for remains of tens of thousands of Native American children

image.altText: A decorative Japanese roof

items.synopsis: Built in Japan, shipped to Brisbane and later purchased for just 600 pounds, the building has no windows and removable walls – but its owners can't imagine living anywhere else.

title.children: How a 135-year-old traditional Japanese house became a family home in a small Queensland town

image.altText: A woman who was born with a cleft sitting down with leaves from a tree blurred out in the foreground.

items.synopsis: Belinda Downes was born with a facial cleft and her mum had a gambling addiction. She says the latter impacts her more to this day.

title.children: Belinda hopes cashless gaming trial will prevent others experiencing the gambling misery she did

image.altText: Vladimir Putin wearing a suit, looking off camera

items.synopsis: The Russian president says he offered mercenaries the opportunity to keep fighting if Prighozin was replaced with another commander, but the Wagner chief declined.

title.children: Putin says Wagner Group 'does not exist', while Biden jokes that Prigozhin should be careful what he eats

image.altText: Seven young children sittin cross-legged on the grass.

items.synopsis: This outback community has more than 100 empty houses. A new mine could bring an influx of residents, but the mining company doesn't want its employees to stay in town.

title.children: Residents hope a new mine will revive this once-thriving town, but the mining company has other plans
